intro: Bunium cylindraceum, commonly known as the cylindrical fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its aromatic properties.
